EVIND_P: The natural environment in and along rivers and lakes
ECOR_P: Local businesses that provide community jobs and income
IEF_P: Large industry such as mining and material processing

EVIND_P: is no longer viable. Air quality is poor, heat is undesirable, and recreation is limited.
ECOR_P: are no longer viable. Jobs and income have rapidly declined.
GWSYA_P: will soon be depleted.  Other sources of water or drastic reductions in demand will be needed.
UEF_P: are complaining that it is too expensive and not enjoyable to live here.
AGIND_P: are finding it hard to remain in business because the cost for ultra-efficient farming is high.
IEF_P: are struggling due to the decrease in groundwater and fresh water supplies.
PEF_P: are struggling. The price of electricity and brownouts are increasing.
SAI_P: are not sufficient to meet demand resulting in a large deficit.

EVIND_P: is declining. Air quality is worse, heat is increasing, with fewer recreation opportunities.
ECOR_P: are declining. Jobs and income are declining. People are worried about their future.
GWSYA_P: are declining. It is uncertain how long groundwater will last.
UEF_P: are very efficient with their water use and understand that some sacrifices are needed to be sustainable.
AGIND_P: are using very efficient farming practices even though the cost to do so is higher.
IEF_P: are adopting new technologies and efficient processes, but the cost to do so is higher.
PEF_P: are aggressively lowering water use with slight increases in electric prices.
SAI_P: are not sufficient to meet demand resulting in a small deficit.

EVIND_P: is stable but stressed. Air quality is stable, heat is bearable, and recreation is stable.
ECOR_P: are stable but stressed. Jobs and income are slowly growing. People are hopeful.
GWSYA_P: are stable. Drought or rapid demand increase may cause problems.
AGIND_P: are balancing efficient farming with the cost of agriculture.
IEF_P: are efficient; industry can be a key water supplier for the environment.
PEF_P: are shifting to lower water use technology and spreading costs over time.

EVIND_P: is doing well. Air quality is improving, heat is stable, and recreation is increasing.
ECOR_P: are doing well. Jobs and income are growing. People are content.
GWSYA_P: are slowly increasing. Chances of surviving a long-term drought are good.
UEF_P: are using more water than is really needed to maintain quality of life and economy.
AGIND_P: are using more water than is needed to maintain a viable agricultural economy.
IEF_P: are growing rapidly and are impacting water availability.
PEF_P: are keeping electricity prices low while making efforts to reduce water use.
SAI_P: are larger than demand resulting in a small surplus.

EVIND_P: is thriving. Air quality is good, heat is declining, and recreation is excellent.
ECOR_P: are thriving. Jobs and income are booming. People are excited.
GWSYA_P: in excellent shape. Chances of surviving a long-term drought are excellent.
UEF_P: are wasting water that could be used for other purposes.
AGIND_P: are using water to maximize economic gains despite potential impacts on long-term water sustainability.
IEF_P: are suffering water shortages, negatively impacting industry's bottom line.
PEF_P: are using water cooling to minimize costs despite impacts on long-term water sustainability.
SAI_P: are larger than demand resulting in a large surplus.
